authortitle: Ross Lovegrove: Organic design, inspired by nature
author: Ross Lovegrove
title: Organic design, inspired by nature
description: Designer Ross Lovegrove expounds his philosophy of "fat-free" design and offers insight into several of his extraordinary products, including the Ty Nant water bottle and the Go chair.

authortitle: Amy Smith: Simple designs to save a life
author: Amy Smith
title: Simple designs to save a life
description: Fumes from indoor cooking fires kill more than 2 million children a year in the developing world. MIT engineer Amy Smith details an exciting but simple solution: a tool for turning farm waste into clean-burning charcoal.

authortitle: Jennifer Lin: Improvising on piano, aged 14
author: Jennifer Lin
title: Improvising on piano, aged 14
description: Pianist and composer Jennifer Lin gives a magical performance, talks about the process of creativity and improvises a moving solo piece based on a random sequence of notes.

authortitle: Sirena Huang: An 11-year-old's magical violin
author: Sirena Huang
title: An 11-year-old's magical violin
description: Violinist Sirena Huang gives a technically brilliant and emotionally nuanced performance. In a charming interlude, the 11-year-old praises the timeless design of her instrument.

authortitle: Jeff Han: The radical promise of the multi-touch interface
author: Jeff Han
title: The radical promise of the multi-touch interface
description: Jeff Han shows off a cheap, scalable multi-touch and pressure-sensitive computer screen interface that may spell the end of point-and-click.

authortitle: Nicholas Negroponte: One Laptop per Child
author: Nicholas Negroponte
title: One Laptop per Child
description: Nicholas Negroponte, founder of the MIT Media Laboratory, describes how the One Laptop Per Child project will build and distribute the "$100 laptop."

authortitle: Dan Dennett: Let's teach religion -- all religion -- in schools
author: Dan Dennett
title: Let's teach religion -- all religion -- in schools
description: Philosopher Dan Dennett calls for religion -- all religion -- to be taught in schools, so we can understand its nature as a natural phenomenon. Then he takes on The Purpose-Driven Life, disputing its claim that, to be moral, one must deny evolution.

authortitle: Rick Warren: A life of purpose
author: Rick Warren
title: A life of purpose
description: Pastor Rick Warren, author of "The Purpose-Driven Life," reflects on his own crisis of purpose in the wake of his book's wild success. He explains his belief that God's intention is for each of us to use our talents and influence to do good.

authortitle: Julia Sweeney: Letting go of God
author: Julia Sweeney
title: Letting go of God
description: When two young Mormon missionaries knock on Julia Sweeney's door one day, it touches off a quest to completely rethink her own beliefs, in this excerpt from Sweeney's solo show "Letting Go of God."

authortitle: Joshua Prince-Ramus: Behind the design of Seattle's library
author: Joshua Prince-Ramus
title: Behind the design of Seattle's library
description: Architect Joshua Prince-Ramus takes the audience on dazzling, dizzying virtual tours of three recent projects: the Central Library in Seattle, the Museum Plaza in Louisville and the Charles Wyly Theater in Dallas.

authortitle: Hans Rosling: The best stats you've ever seen
author: Hans Rosling
title: The best stats you've ever seen
description: You've never seen data presented like this. With the drama and urgency of a sportscaster, statistics guru Hans Rosling debunks myths about the so-called "developing world."

authortitle: Sir Ken Robinson: Do schools kill creativity?
author: Sir Ken Robinson
title: Do schools kill creativity?

authortitle: Majora Carter: Greening the ghetto
author: Majora Carter
title: Greening the ghetto
description: In an emotionally charged talk, MacArthur-winning activist Majora Carter details her fight for environmental justice in the South Bronx -- and shows how minority neighborhoods suffer most from flawed urban policy.

authortitle: Lauren Sallan:  A brief tour of the last 4 billion years (dinosaurs not included)
author: Lauren Sallan
title: A brief tour of the last 4 billion years (dinosaurs not included)

authortitle: Jay Van Bavel: Do politics make us irrational?
author: Jay Van Bavel
title: Do politics make us irrational?

authortitle: Jen Gunter: Why can't we talk about periods?
author: Jen Gunter
title: Why can't we talk about periods?

authortitle: Sheila Marie Orfano: Why should you read "The Joy Luck Club" by Amy Tan?
author: Sheila Marie Orfano
title: Why should you read "The Joy Luck Club" by Amy Tan?

authortitle: LaToya Ruby Frazier: A creative solution for the water crisis in Flint, Michigan
author: LaToya Ruby Frazier
title: A creative solution for the water crisis in Flint, Michigan

authortitle: Bhakti Sharma: What open water swimming taught me about resilience
author: Bhakti Sharma
title: What open water swimming taught me about resilience

authortitle: Bjarke Ingels: An architect's guide to living on Mars
author: Bjarke Ingels
title: An architect's guide to living on Mars

authortitle: Mohammad Modarres: Why you should shop at your local farmers market
author: Mohammad Modarres
title: Why you should shop at your local farmers market

authortitle: Lorin Swint Matthews: The dust bunnies that built our planet
author: Lorin Swint Matthews
title: The dust bunnies that built our planet

authortitle: Judy Cebra-Thomas: How turtle shells evolved... twice
author: Judy Cebra-Thomas
title: How turtle shells evolved... twice

authortitle: Emma Lazarus: "New Colossus"
author: Emma Lazarus
title: "New Colossus"

author: Emeli Sandé
title: "You Are Not Alone" / "Extraordinary Being" / "Shine"

authortitle: Baratunde Thurston: How to deconstruct racism, one headline at a time
author: Baratunde Thurston
title: How to deconstruct racism, one headline at a time

authortitle: Alex Gendler: Why should you read "Crime and Punishment"?
author: Alex Gendler
title: Why should you read "Crime and Punishment"?

authortitle: Danielle N. Lee: How hip-hop helps us understand science
author: Danielle N. Lee
title: How hip-hop helps us understand science

authortitle: Michelle Mehrtens: The historic women's suffrage march on Washington
author: Michelle Mehrtens
title: The historic women's suffrage march on Washington

authortitle: Steven Petrow: 3 ways to practice civility
author: Steven Petrow
title: 3 ways to practice civility

authortitle: Mai Lan: "Autopilote" / "Pumper"
author: Mai Lan
title: "Autopilote" / "Pumper"

authortitle: Alex Gendler: Can you solve the multiplying rabbits riddle?
author: Alex Gendler
title: Can you solve the multiplying rabbits riddle?

authortitle: Carla Harris: How to find the person who can help you get ahead at work
author: Carla Harris
title: How to find the person who can help you get ahead at work

authortitle: Melvin Sanicas: Why is meningitis so dangerous?
author: Melvin Sanicas
title: Why is meningitis so dangerous?

authortitle: Rebecca Onie: What Americans agree on when it comes to health
author: Rebecca Onie
title: What Americans agree on when it comes to health

authortitle: Kaitlyn Sadtler: How we could teach our bodies to heal faster
author: Kaitlyn Sadtler
title: How we could teach our bodies to heal faster

authortitle: Emma Bryce: The power of the placebo effect
author: Emma Bryce
title: The power of the placebo effect

authortitle: Leticia Gasca: Una nueva manera de hablar del fracaso en los negocios
author: Leticia Gasca
title: Una nueva manera de hablar del fracaso en los negocios

authortitle: Iseult Gillespie: The Irish myth of the Giant's Causeway
author: Iseult Gillespie
title: The Irish myth of the Giant's Causeway

authortitle: Michael Hendryx: The shocking danger of mountaintop removal -- and why it must end
author: Michael Hendryx
title: The shocking danger of mountaintop removal -- and why it must end

authortitle: Diane Wolk-Rogers: A Parkland teacher's homework for us all
author: Diane Wolk-Rogers
title: A Parkland teacher's homework for us all

authortitle: Naomi Klein: How shocking events can spark positive change
author: Naomi Klein
title: How shocking events can spark positive change

authortitle: Marco Alverà: The surprising ingredient that makes businesses work better
author: Marco Alverà
title: The surprising ingredient that makes businesses work better

authortitle: Erick Brethenoux: The big data behind complex human emotions
author: Erick Brethenoux
title: The big data behind complex human emotions

authortitle: Fredros Okumu: Why I study the most dangerous animal on earth -- mosquitoes
author: Fredros Okumu
title: Why I study the most dangerous animal on earth -- mosquitoes

authortitle: Sue Jaye Johnson: What we don't teach kids about sex
author: Sue Jaye Johnson
title: What we don't teach kids about sex

authortitle: Philipp Gerbert: The basics of AI for business
author: Philipp Gerbert
title: The basics of AI for business

authortitle: Nikki Webber Allen: Don't suffer from your depression in silence
author: Nikki Webber Allen
title: Don't suffer from your depression in silence

authortitle: Ray Dalio: How to build a company where the best ideas win
author: Ray Dalio
title: How to build a company where the best ideas win
description: What if you knew what your coworkers really thought about you and what they were really like? Ray Dalio makes the business case for using radical transparency and algorithmic decision-making to create an idea meritocracy where people can speak up and say what they really think -- even calling out the boss is fair game. Learn more about how these strategies helped Dalio create one of the world's most successful hedge funds and how you might harness the power of data-driven group decision-making.

authortitle: Jennifer Pluznick: You smell with your body, not just your nose
author: Jennifer Pluznick
title: You smell with your body, not just your nose
description: Do your kidneys have a sense of smell? Turns out, the same tiny scent detectors found in your nose are also found in some pretty unexpected places -- like your muscles, kidneys and even your lungs. In this quick talk (filled with weird facts), physiologist Jennifer Pluznick explains why they're there and what they do.

authortitle: Rhiannon Giddens: Songs that bring history to life
author: Rhiannon Giddens
title: Songs that bring history to life
description: Rhiannon Giddens pours the emotional weight of American history into her music. Listen as she performs traditional folk ballads -- including "Waterboy," "Up Above My Head," and "Lonesome Road" by Sister Rosetta Tharp -- and one glorious original song, "Come Love Come," inspired by Civil War-era slave narratives.

authortitle: Mena Trott: Meet the founder of the blog revolution
author: Mena Trott
title: Meet the founder of the blog revolution
description: The founding mother of the blog revolution, Movable Type's Mena Trott, talks about the early days of blogging, when she realized that giving regular people the power to share our lives online is the key to building a friendlier, more connected world.

authortitle: Ze Frank: Nerdcore comedy
author: Ze Frank
title: Nerdcore comedy
description: Performer and web toymaker Ze Frank delivers a hilarious nerdcore standup routine, then tells us what he's seriously passionate about: helping people create and interact using simple, addictive web tools.

authortitle: Nathan D. Horowitz: The Amazonian myth of the goblins' revenge
author: Nathan D. Horowitz
title: The Amazonian myth of the goblins' revenge

authortitle: Nirupa Rao: An illustrated kingdom of fantastical plants
author: Nirupa Rao
title: An illustrated kingdom of fantastical plants

authortitle: Joel Leon: The beautiful, hard work of co-parenting
author: Joel Leon
title: The beautiful, hard work of co-parenting

authortitle: Matthew A. Wilson: The health benefits of clowning around
author: Matthew A. Wilson
title: The health benefits of clowning around

authortitle: Enrico Ramirez-Ruiz: Your body was forged in the spectacular death of stars
author: Enrico Ramirez-Ruiz
title: Your body was forged in the spectacular death of stars

authortitle: Joy Wolfram: How nanoparticles could change the way we treat cancer
author: Joy Wolfram
title: How nanoparticles could change the way we treat cancer

authortitle: Moreangels Mbizah: How community-led conservation can save wildlife
author: Moreangels Mbizah
title: How community-led conservation can save wildlife

authortitle: Dr. Phillip Atiba Goff: How we can make racism a solvable problem -- and improve policing
author: Dr. Phillip Atiba Goff
title: How we can make racism a solvable problem -- and improve policing
